title: Never Even Heard of Tyler1 Before Getting Banned. I watched one of his recorded streams...
body:
And holy shit he was a douchebag. I'm reading these forum posts about him having 20 CHANCES to get his shit straight. Man Rito, you be generous.

Edit: I personally would get a petition to ban him from every game he plays. His toxicity will just go to another game. He's now playing Overwatch so RIP

replies.body: Nah man. He's REFORMED, his cult will inform you.
And as you speak, just below you "NoobLord420" has a post. Congrats. You are officially god Lady Carry :P
If he was given 20 chances to get his shit straight then Rito had a right to permaban this guy. League don't need players like that for their community.
Exactly. In fact a person with common sense would get reformed after the first time lol

He reformed pretty hard tbh. While i was watching his streams he was being way more adult that i am when i play. People would legit troll him while talking shit in team chat/all chat and all he would do is mute. Takes self control to do that

He hasn't retormed enough. He still isn't good for the community, and the community has spoken by reporting him enough to have him perma banned 20 times. He is not welcome in League ever again, and for good reason.
Upon identification, so he can play incognito but when he is discovered he will be banned.
Well... the thing is that he can still play League. He just can't stream it.

I actually (shamefully) watched him a bit near the end and I will say after having watched his old stuff too,

He used to be 10 times worse. He would feed, afk, and troll often for just stupid reasons, all while spewing some of the worst things a human could even say in chat. 

He reformed himself in the sense he does not do these things nearly as often or as aggressively. He still does say permaban worthy things in chat and unfortunately, or fortunately if you look at it that way, he still did still troll in game when he didn't get his way, even after his "reform".  

He definitely toned it down and showed some real balls not responding to the players trolling him and they definitely deserve a ban as well (along with some other popular streamers probably), but the fact was he still did commit bannable in-game offenses even after his reform, so they cut him after his 20th "final" chance.

"He reformed himself in the sense he does not do these things nearly as often or as aggressively". 

He was unbearable and now hes a little bit less unbearable. In the end, still unbearable. Should have been permabanned on the 3rd strike.

Looking at it at that level is knit picking just for the 1-2 words he'd say in 30games. He was a hell of a lot better and didn't earn the ban this time around. Seems like he was ban just because he was having one of the fastest growing channels ever. Perhaps Riot is just racist? (I kid about this one.)

> [{quoted}](name=Chucks719,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=qtKiup49,comment-id=000100020000,timestamp=2016-04-30T23:22:30.418+0000)
>
> Looking at it at that level is knit picking just for the 1-2 words he'd say in 30games. He was a hell of a lot better and didn't earn the ban this time around. Seems like he was ban just because he was having one of the fastest growing channels ever. 

1-2 words in 30 games?? no, no at least be semi-realistic man! He flamed way more than that and intentionally fed, which is not knit-picking offenses. You should be permanently banned for feeding and flaming at all, but I agree that it was a weird time to "indefinitely" ban him. I could see them banning him just because his channel was growing so fast and they wanted to put a stop to the glorification of being toxic, but either way just because you used to troll and flame a ton doesn't mean you're allowed to troll and flame even a little. And if anything he is under a larger microscope for being so well known and already on their perma ban list.

Personally i think anyone who intentionally feeds deserves some kind of punishment, myself included. Ive only ever been driven to it twice, and i was waaaaaaaay too raging at the time to care. Im glad nothing happened because of it, and i have made serious efforts to reform myself after the second time. If you literally say you are intentionally feeding you deserve a punishment, more so if you are a "popular" streamer. If people see streamers doing it they go oh its ok for me to do it too, when it isnt. Popularity comes with the price of higher visibility, and deserves to be held to higher standards.

Which is still an injustice considering he has done a whole lot better. 

He flamed and fed often but that was before he said he'd turn it around. He really did take it a lot more serious afterward.

So it's okay if you get a guy in your team who intentionally feed? And in the next game the same guy again and he is doing this again? 
As long as he isn't doing it as often as he did it some time ago?

A serious question:
What would you do if Tyler1 was somehow in your game and started to run down mid?
Wouldn't you be pissed?

> [{quoted}](name=Chucks719,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=qtKiup49,comment-id=00010002000000000001,timestamp=2016-05-01T06:38:11.558+0000)
>
> Which is still an injustice considering he has done a whole lot better. 
> 
> He flamed and fed often but that was before he said he'd turn it around. He really did take it a lot more serious afterward.

No? It has nothing to do with how he, or ANYONE ELSE, used to act. You can't judge him relative to his old self, you only can judge him relative to the rules riot set in their term and conds. And he said he would turn it around and reform then he intentionally fed... If he was reformed he would not int, troll, or afk EVER. Like millions of players do everyday. Consequences exist.

Imagine you stole an iphone from walmart so they ban you. You change locations and go back to a walmart and steal a t.v. and get banned again. You get banned 20 times, and the 21st time they catch you stealing a candy bar, they will not give a shit that you were doing better, or that you claim you were reformed, or that it's just a candy bar compared to the iphones you used to steal, you're now life banned from walmart at any location. You should not have stolen the candy bar period. 

Honestly what's wrong with you? It's fine to like the guy, he's not everyone's cup of tea for obvious reasons, but you can't just try to create an alternate reality and ignore the fact that he thought he could keep getting away with breaking the rules and got punished for doing something he shouldn't have done? Hell he could've kept the subs, cash, channel, all of it if would've been fine if he would just flame everyone on camera not in chat, or not intentionally fed when he doesn't get his way. Grown ups don't get to act like this in the real world, save for when you people take your shitty lives out on restaurant staff, so accept that the only reason you still want him playing is because you think he's funny. 

You know who else thinks afking and trolling are funny? The people that afk and troll in your games, the people you hate and I'm sure flame and report.

> [{quoted}](name=Jungle Brungus,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=qtKiup49,comment-id=00010002,timestamp=2016-04-30T20:50:25.687+0000)
>
> I actually (shamefully) watched him a bit near the end and I will say after having watched his old stuff too,
> 
> He used to be 10 times worse. He would feed, afk, and troll often for just stupid reasons, all while spewing some of the worst things a human could even say in chat. 
> 
> He reformed himself in the sense he does not do these things nearly as often or as aggressively. He still does say permaban worthy things in chat and unfortunately, or fortunately if you look at it that way, he still did still troll in game when he didn't get his way, even after his "reform".  
> 
> He definitely toned it down and showed some real balls not responding to the players trolling him and they definitely deserve a ban as well (along with some other popular streamers probably), but the fact was he still did commit bannable in-game offenses even after his reform, so they cut him after his 20th "final" chance.

This! This so hard one thing I really want people to see is that he tried but people actually provoked this dude and should be punished also

The whole thing about Tyler1. He is actually really entertaining/funny to watch...But thats it. Anyone who actually wants him unbanned, never has had him on their team before. I think just about 4 days ago, before his d1 acc got banned, he started intentional feeding bot (even though we clearly had a chance to win) because one thing went wrong...So yeah, i think he is funny, and prolly deep down inside a really cool guy. But if its true that he has been acting that way for about 15 accounts, and had that much time to "reform". then i am sorry brother...You had so much time to change your ways :(

Bro his win ratio on all all his accounts is better than 99% of the league community so I would actually love to have him on my and carry for a win. Would your average ranked player want me with a less than 50% win ratio in ranked or a master level draven who occasionally tells his support he sucks on their team? Please anyone would take Tyler1.

I mean, a lot of people tend to use Meteos as an example of another ban-worthy player, so I'll use him in my example for now -

Honestly I'd rather have Meteos over Tyler anyday - Meteos can be a piece of shit but he doesn't (or from what I've seen) intentionally feed or throw away winnable games just because someone didn't give him blue buff. Both of them can be assholes in chat but only one of them seems to actually do perma-ban worthy shit when it comes to actual actions, rather than just mutable words.

Does anyone remember dunkey?  Don't get me wrong Ghost Ghost, I thought he was fun to watch as well, but some of the stuff he says in chat is too overboard.  But he, as far as I could tell, was an excellent player, and he probably was a good guy as well.  But the reason for his ban was just, because of the offensive commentary he made.  Sure I'll miss his League videos, but he has other funny stuff as well.
Oh god he's playing Overwatch? Not my game pls. At least Blizzard loves putting down the ban hammer
Yea, you only gave Dunkey 1

Dunkey was given a 14-day ban and then quit League altogether (for reasons he stated didn't (entirely) have to do with the ban).

Tyler1 was perma-banned on 20 separate accounts before Riot put its foot down and ultra-banned him
They banned one account and he quit, thats different.
Wasn't it only a 2 week ban also?
It was. Dunkey was looking for an excuse to quit league. He just wasn't enjoying it anymore. He didn't want to make content for it or continue playing
Well, most streamers I know don't enjoy league as much as they used to.  The current meta and dynamic queue have shitted up what was a pretty good competitive game.

I came onto the forums today on a whim, and I'm gonna be honest I was a little confused for awhile. I have never heard of Tyler1, Meteos, Nicktron, or Kaceyton. So, from an unattached perspective I'm not sure what the fuss is about. 

If Tyler has been banned 19 times in the past I don't see why is such a surprise that he's been banned again? And who is to say the Riot wont ban the other steamers mentioned? It seems pretty clear that Tyler1 was a bigger problem so maybe they just addressed this guy first. At the end of the day there is one less troll playing the game so what's the problem? A person isn't playing a game anymore. That is literally all that happened. 

P.S. It's kind of funny that some Tyler1 fans are complaining about the fact League players are ultra sensitive when they are the ones getting so upset about something so inconsequential.
He received a player ban. To put it simply he isn't allowed to play League ever again.
There's no chat in overwatch
There are many other ways to be toxic other than a chat. Tyler1 will find a way to be toxic. That's his nature. That's the person he is.

There is a push to talk button
I believe there is a chat as well but I could be wrong on that!
Man why are people so soft these days
People aren't soft they don't want to be berated by assholes.
Saying Tyler1 is reformed is like saying a mass murderer that now only kills a few people is reformed. Less toxic garbage is still garbage.

Poor riot Socrates. His butthurt fans downvoted him to oblivion in his thread. I'm personally glad he's gone. He was a bad example for anyone playing the game, even if he was "entertaining". He made me cringe when I watched a few of his vids. Dude thinks he's black or something.
Damnit... and I was getting excited to play Overwatch
Yep
Was gonna upvote but then I saw your EDIT. .-.

He's playing OverWatch...?

WELL SO MUCH FOR A GOOD FUCKING COMMUNITY, EH BOYS?

*kills self*
All that toxicity, surprises me how he made it to diamond+.

Logged in to upvote.
Cuz AMEN
